text:
We have been able to reproduce this problem consistently with 2.0.43 through 
2.0.47.

When there are many(~50) small images (GIFs and JPGs) on a web page, IE renders 
most of them but not all. Each refresh, different images are broken.
After right-click, "show image" on any broken image, IE will show it and from 
then on all images will show every time upon page refresh.

This problem does not occur with Mozilla 1.3.
creator: ivelin@apache.org

text:
Are there any interesting errorlog entries? (You may adjust LogLevel to 'info'
or so to see them).

Thanks.
creator: nd@perlig.de
peter.kepes@smartx.hu
text:
Hi!

I have same problem with Tomcat 4.1.12 on Linux and 4.1.24 on Windows 2000 too. 
I generate HTML output from JSP, and sometimes after long wait IE6 just show 
broken image. I have only few images on this page.
I try to debug the JSP page, but it seems some communication problem because 
the JSP page runs normaly.
If anybody have a solution please share with me!

  Thanks

creator: svmf20@wi.rr.com
text:
I also have this problem.  I am using Windows XP Pro with all current service 
pack updates along with IE 6 and Apache 2.0.48.

Images and page doesn't load all the way.  I am trying to access it through 
the same computer.  Plz help.

creator: chip@force-elite.com
text:
This sounds like a win32 specific problem.

Add these to your configuration file: 
EnableSendfile Off
EnableMMAP Off
Win32DisableAcceptex
